description: Detects narratives asserting human separation or superiority over other life forms, particularly when insecurity drives domination or exploitation. Flags cyclical reinforcement between harm and justification.

linguistic: separation rhetoric ('above nature', 'masters of the earth')
devaluation of non-human intelligence ('instinct only', 'mere animals')
behavioral: resource exploitation justified as destiny or right
symbolic control rituals (ownership, classification, patenting of life)
defensive anger when kinship with other species is suggested
structural: policy privileging human benefit over ecological continuity
economic growth tied to extraction of living systems

fusion_logic.method: feedback loop detection between insecurity markers and dominance behaviors

recommended_reframe: Reassert belonging within ecosystems rather than above them.
Center interdependence metrics (pollination, microbial balance, reciprocity).
Replace conquest metaphors with stewardship or symbiosis metaphors.
